alert.note: Alert for Carlton; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 3:21PM CDT until August 17 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Duluth has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Carlton County in northeastern Minnesota... Southern St. Louis County in northeastern Minnesota... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 321 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mahtowa, Barnum, Fond Du Lac Band Sawyer Area, Fond Du Lac Band Cloquet Area, Big Lake, Sawyer and Kettle Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
